sect1.title: The User InterfaceUser Interface
sect1.para: &logtracker; is a stand alone application which requires file system access to the log files that it analyzes. When the application is started (see ) a window with some dockable panelsdockable panels is displayed.
A typical view of the application is shown in : At the top of the application frame there is a toolbar with some action buttons:

listitem.para: Loads a configuration file. Configuration files either contain a fully configured &logtracker; instance &logtracker; instance (see ), or a collection of configured log file parsers (see ).
Saves the actual configuration of the application to a configuration file (see ).

varlistentry.term: Add new file configuration windowAdd new file configuration window

listitem.para: Adds a new dockable file selection window to the application. This special window serves as a starting point for new data pipelines.
The view in was created by starting &logtracker; and pressing this button once.

varlistentry.term: Open Configuration Dialog BoxOpen Configuration Dialog Box

listitem.para: Opens the dialog box for application wide configuration (see ).
Open the help windowhelp window and show this document.

sect1.para: All other content is organized in dockable panels. Dockable panels can be resized and moved around by the user by clicking onto their header and dragging them. Some special buttons allow window operations such as minimize panelminimizing, maximize panelmaximizing, detaching. A comprehensive description of the possible interactions can be found on the Docking Frames Docking Frames Website.

listitem.para: Lists problems that may have occurred during the processing of the log files.

Serves as a starting point for setting up a new data pipeline. Within this window, log files that are going to be processed and monitored and their log files format are being configured. The processing is launched by pressing the Apply-button.
